info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued October 10 at 3:37PM AKDT until October 13 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks AK
info.description:
* WHAT...Major coastal flooding is likely. Water levels 5 to 10 feet above the normal highest tide line at Nome, and 8 to 13 feet above the normal highest tide line at Golovin. The highest water levels will be Sunday morning through Monday afternoon. This storm is the remnants of Typhoon Halong. Water levels will be higher than the October 8th storm and may be higher than the remnants of Typhoon Merbok at Golovin.
* WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast.
* WHEN...From 4 AM Sunday to 4 PM AKDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...At Golovin, major coastal flooding is likely and water levels may approach record levels. it is likely that water will overtop the berm, causing significant inundation. Many residences, the school, drinking water source, tank farm, store, clinic, and more may be inundated or surrounded with water. The old runway will be overtopped. Significant erosion is likely. At Nome, homes in the Belmont Subdivision and areas near the port will be inundated. Water will approach Norton Sound Seafood Products. Water may cut off access between the tarmac and airport terminal. Nome-Council Road may become impassable. Debris on front street is likely.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.

parameter.value: COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SUNDAY TO 4 PM AKDT MONDAY
